headline: Palo Alto Networks, Grindr, SoundHound AI: Trending Tickers
summary: Wealth host Brad Smith takes a look at three top trending tickers on Yahoo Finance. Palo Alto Networks (PANW) has executed its 2-for-1 stock split, with trading now effective on a split basis. Following the split, Stifel has adjusted its price target on the stock. Grindr (GRND) shares are experiencing upward momentum after Goldman Sachs initiated coverage on the dating app company with a $20 price target and a Buy rating, signaling positive market sentiment. SoundHound AI (SOUN) is also moving higher as Wedbush Securities raised its price target to $22 per share, up from $10. The upgrade highlights the company's potential in the early stages of its growth initiatives. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here. This post was written by Angel Smith
